title: LISTING_ACCESS_HISTORY view: New columns | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: This behavior change is in the 2024_05 bundle.
For the current status of the bundle, refer to Bundle History.

When this behavior change bundle is enabled, the LISTING_ACCESS_HISTORY view
includes the following new columns:

TRUE if the access was on a share.
When TRUE, the LISTING_OBJECTS_ACCESSED column provides details about the share objects accessed by the consumer query.

TRUE if the access was on an application.
When TRUE, APPLICATION_OBJECTS_ACCESSED column provides details about the application objects accessed by the consumer query.

See LISTING_OBJECTS_ACCESSED array for formatting.
Is NULL when IS_SHARE is FALSE.
Note: this column has the same data as the LISTING_OBJECTS_ACCESSED column.
It is recommended to use SHARE_OBJECTS_ACCESSED instead of LISTING_OBJECTS_ACCESSED as it may be deprecated in the future.
Is NULL when IS_APPLICATION is FALSE.
The current name of the application package from which the application was installed.
Is NULL when IS_APPLICATION is FALSE.
The version of the application when this query occurred.
Is NULL when IS_APPLICATION is FALSE.
The patch number of the application when this query occurred.
Is NULL when IS_APPLICATION is FALSE.

The APPLICATION_OBJECTS_ACCESSED array provides details about the objects in an application accessed by a consumer query.
The format of an item in the array depends on the type of object that was accessed.
Object IDs are not available and database names are masked.
